CIRCULAR  05  /  1998 
 
 
 
SUB : SECURITY ARRANGEMENTS AT AIRPORT 
 
 
 
 
 
In order to standardize the procedure for monitoring and inspection of security 
measures pertaining to cargo being carried by civil flights the following directions are issued: 
- 
 
(i) 
Regional Deputy Commissioner of Security (CA), BCAS will check the 
availability of trained security personnel with the Airlines and that they are 
adequately deployed for the duration of handling of the cargo, loading / 
unloading and till the closing of the holds.  This exercise should be undertaken 
by RDCOS once a year for each airline operating in his jurisdiction. 
 
(ii) 
Officers of the Bureau will conduct random surprise checks to ensure that 
Airlines are abiding by the cooling off restrictions.  During these checks, the 
availability of the staff and whether they are capable in the civil aviation 
security duties should also be scrutinized. 
 
(iii) 
Flight schedules of Freighters are published and are available.  Regular 
monitoring 
of 
security 
measures 
should 
be

Regional 
Dy. 
Commissioners of Security (CA), BCAS for these flights.
